description: As the holy month of Ramadan comes to an end, Palestinians are celebrating amid the devastation of the ongoing war between Israel and Hamas. But for many, it was a day of mourning. Among them was Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, whose three sons and four grandchildren were killed in an Israeli airstrike. Debora Patta reports.
title: Palestinians celebrate Eid al-Fitr amid war

description: Both Democrats and Republicans are criticizing a Civil War-era abortion ban that's set to take effect after Arizona's Supreme Court ruled the statute could be enforced. President Biden has vowed to restore Roe v. Wade if reelected, while former President Trump said the Arizona law goes too far. Nancy Cordes has the latest.
title: Arizona abortion law faces criticism

description: Police in Akron, Ohio, have released body-worn camera video of officers shooting 15-year-old Tavion Koonce-Williams, who had a toy gun. The teenager survived being shot in the wrist, and the officer has been placed on leave. Elaine Quijano has the latest.
title: Video shows Akron police shooting teen who had toy gun

description: The storms impacting the Gulf Coast are predicted to continue moving east. The Weather Channel meteorologist Mike Bettes has the forecast.
title: Storms expected to move east

description: Storms lashed the Southeast on Wednesday, bringing flooding and tornadoes to parts of the Gulf Coast. Mark Strassmann reports.
title: Gulf Coast hit with tornadoes and flooding

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Wednesday, April 10, 2024

description: Canadian officials say the country's upcoming wildfire season could be more explosive than last year's historic season.
title: Canada at risk of another catastrophic wildfire season, government warns

description: The Iowa law could mean criminal charges for people who have outstanding deportation orders, or who have previously been removed from or denied admission to the U.S.
title: Iowa governor signs bill that allows for arrest of some migrants

description: Arizona Democratic Gov. Katie Hobbs on Wednesday called on lawmakers to repeal a near-total abortion ban from 1864 after the state's Supreme Court ruled it could be enforced. Elizabeth Campbell, Shawna Mizelle, Molly Ball and Deepa Shivaram join to discuss the latest.
title: Arizona Gov. Katie Hobbs calls for repeal of near-total abortion ban

description: Five people are in custody after a shooting at an event celebrating the end of Ramadan in West Philadelphia, police said. Philadelphia Police Commissioner Kevin Bethel provided provided an update on the shooting. Doug Kouns, a former FBI special agent, joined CBS News with more on the investigation.
title: 5 in custody after shooting at Ramadan event in Philadelphia, police say

description: For decades, politicians have used the threat of crime to try to win over voters. Insha Rahman, vice president of advocacy and partnerships at the Vera Institute of Justice, joins "America Decides" to explore the strategy's effectiveness even when crime rates start dropping.
title: How effective are crime-focused political ads?

description: President Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida announced plans Wednesday for closer military and intelligence cooperation. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has the details.
title: How U.S. and Japan plan to work together to counter China

description: The house, which was built in 2017, has a five-car garage, and three-and-a-half baths.
title: Convicted child abuser's $5 million Utah home most viewed real estate listing

description: The best pest control companies of 2024 can help you deal with annoying pest infestations and unwanted critters.
title: The best pest control companies of 2024 will keep your house bug (and stress) free

description: President Biden and first lady Jill Biden are honoring Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and Japan.
title: A look at the White House state dinner for Japan in photos

description: Ralph Puckett Jr., a retired Army colonel who was awarded the Medal of Honor in 2021 for heroism during the Korean War, died at age 97.
title: Ralph Puckett Jr., awarded Medal of Honor by Biden in 2021, dies at 97

description: Arizona Attorney General Kris Mayes tells CBS News she will not prosecute women and doctors who violate an 1864 abortion ban law that was upheld by the state's supreme court Tuesday. The ban has exceptions only to save the life of the mother but none in cases of rape or incest.
title: Arizona attorney general says she will not prosecute women, doctors who violate abortion law

description: If you've been thinking about giving your three- to 12-year old their own tablet, Amazon's kid-friendly options are on sale.

description: If you've been thinking about giving your three- to 12-year old their own tablet, Amazon's kid-friendly options are on sale.

description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday new regulations to limit the amount of "forever chemicals," known as PFAS, found in drinking water. CBS News senior national and environmental correspondent Ben Tracy has more.
title: EPA announces new drinking water regulations

description: Some of the nation's biggest companies are discriminating against Black job applicants, according to a new report by the National Bureau of Economic Research. Researchers contacted 97 companies with 80,000 resumes over three years. Evan Rose, a co-author of the "A Discrimination Report Card," joins CBS News with more details on the research.
title: Some companies discriminate against Black job applicants more than others, report finds

description: The airline is replacing branded boarding group names with numbered zones, through 8.
title: Delta is changing how it boards passengers starting May 1

description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, a Republican from Georgia, took to social media Wednesday with another threat to oust House Speaker Mike Johnson. Meanwhile, the House has delayed efforts to deliver two impeachment articles to the Senate against Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro Mayorkas. CBS News' Nikole Killion reports.
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene threatens to oust Speaker Johnson

description: Get sparkling-clean windows with a bot that's happy to handle yet another part of your household chore list.
title: This CES-famous Ecovacs Winbot W2 Omni window-washing robot is the ultimate spring-cleaning flex

description: As inflation persists, it's important to earn a strong return on your savings. Here are three accounts to open now.

description: Beat the summer heat with one of these portable air conditioners.

description: Multiple people were shot in West Philadelphia on Wednesday, police said. Several people are in custody, according to police. CBS News Philadelphia reports.

description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene continues to dangle the threat of ousting House Speaker Mike Johnson, warning that she's "watching what happens" on Ukraine funding and the reauthorization of FISA.

description: The sales performance comes amid online buzz and as the price of gold is reaching new heights.

description: In his first television interview since he was attacked at a literary festival in Chautauqua, New York almost two years ago, author Salman Rushdie details his experience to Anderson Cooper. Sunday on 60 Minutes.

description: A bill that would reauthorize a crucial national security surveillance program has been blocked by a conservative revolt, pushing the prospects of final passage into uncertainty.
title: House blocks bill to renew FISA spy program after conservative revolt

description: Multiple people were shot at the end of a Ramadan event in West Philadelphia on Wednesday afternoon, according to police.

description: Are you in the market for a second home? Here's how you can use a home equity loan to make your purchase.

description: An American living in Colombia distributed flyers and advertised on social media for tourists to attend a "cannabis tour."

description: President Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida held a joint press conference in the White House Rose Garden Wednesday to discuss new collaboration efforts between the two nations. The two leaders discussed an enhanced military and intelligence partnership and a focus on economic cooperation. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang reports.
title: Biden, Japan's Kishida hold press conference with focus on China

description: President Biden once again is trying to deliver widespread student debt forgiveness, with a new plan unveiled on Monday that could help about 30 million borrowers erase some or all of their college loans. It comes less than a year after the Supreme Court blocked Mr. Biden's previous attempt to help student borrowers. Here's who will qualify for debt forgiveness under the new plan.
title: Who will qualify for debt forgiveness under Biden's new student loan forgiveness plan?

description: Discover the five best wood pellet grills that can help take your outdoor grilling to the next level.

description: President Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Wednesday will announce new efforts in defense and intelligence cooperation between the two countries, senior administration officials said. CBS News' Willie James Inman reports.
title: Biden, Kishida to announce new U.S.-Japan military partnership efforts

description: Long before there was a crisis in Hawaii involving flames, there was a crisis involving water: water that climate change was drying up, scarce water going to tourist activities instead of locals, and then tainted water that poisoned thousands with jet fuel from Red Hill. Months before the Maui wildfires, CBS News traveled to O'ahu to see what experts call an immense and existential threat to life on the island.
title: Trouble in the Water: Hawaii's Climate Crisis

description: A study published in the Harvard Law Review found there was a spike in nationwide orders blocking federal policies during the Trump administration.

description: Former President Donald Trump continued to praise the Supreme Court's June 2022 decision overturning Roe v. Wade.

description: "Honest has been a true labor of love for me," the "Fantastic Four" actress said of the personal care company she founded in 2012.

description: Gold can be a smart investment to consider when inflation is higher than normal. Here's why.

description: Patricia Wick pleaded guilty to felony charges of murder and child abuse and a misdemeanor of operating an unlicensed day care center.
title: North Dakota woman gets nearly 19 years in baby's day care death

description: House Republicans have postponed until next week sending articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas to the Senate. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more.

description: "You can kiss a June interest rate cut goodbye," Greg McBride, chief financial analyst at Bankrate, said in a research note on the latest CPI numbers.

description: When a woman disappears with her boyfriend, investigators learn he was entrusted with millions at his bank job, but he also told outlandish lies about who he was. "48 Hours" contributor Michelle Miller reports Saturday, April 13 at 9/8c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: Where is Diana Duve?

description: The Arizona Supreme Court reinstated an abortion law from the 1860s that is a near-total ban. There is no exception for rape or incest, the law says, but is an exception to save the life of the mother.

description: Former President Donald Trump will take part in two fundraisers Wednesday as he tries to cut into the cash lead the Biden campaign has built up. President Biden's campaign is currently reporting over $192 million on hand while the Trump team is reporting $93.1 million. CBS News campaign reporter Jake Rosen has more.
title: Trump working on fundraising, Biden campaign still winning cash battle

description: Summer camp sticker shock has some parents looking for ways to cut costs.

CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O'Keefe has more.

description: Are you drowning in credit card debt? If so, it could make sense to explore these options.

description: A rare six-legged mountain gazelle was spotted in Israel. "Contrary to expectations, the gazelle is healthy, strong" said a conservationist, who added that extra legs don't pose a challenge to him.

description: The Consumer Price Index rose 0.4% last month largely due to the cost of rent and gas. Prices are up 3.5% over the past 12 months and the latest numbers are casting doubt on any interest rate cuts. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger has more.

description: Chad Daybell​ is charged in Idaho with killing his wife and the two youngest children of his then-girlfriend, Lori Vallow Daybell.

description: It could make sense to sell your gold investment in certain scenarios, but it depends on your situation.

description: Marcus King’s new album takes a personal look at the darkest days of his mental health journey. It also focuses on the Grammy-nominated musician’s hope found through therapy and music.
title: Grammy-nominated musician Marcus King’s new album explores his mental health journey

description: The Arizona Supreme Court's decision upholding a law from 1864 that bans abortion with barely any exceptions has led to confusion about when the law will take effect and how it will be enforced. CBS News campaign reporter Shawna Mizelle has more.
title: Confusion over Civil War-era abortion ban in Arizona

description: A longtime Boeing engineer has come forward with claims about flaws in the 787 Dreamliner, alleging the company took shortcuts during assembly. Boeing is strongly denying the claims, but CBS News has learned federal regulators are looking into the matter. CBS News senior transportation correspondent Kris Van Cleave has more.
title: New safety allegations against Boeing from whistleblower

description: Proposed new rates would take effect in July and increase mailing services product prices approximately 7.8%, USPS says.
title: Stamp prices poised to rise again, for the 2nd time this year

description: President Biden has increased his criticism of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his handling of the war with Hamas. The president called for total access to food and medicine in Gaza. Meanwhile, Vice President Kamala Harris met with families of American hostages who have been held by Hamas for the past six months, as the U.S. works with Qatar and Israel on a ceasefire deal and the release of hostages.
title: Biden increases criticism of Netanyahu as Harris visits with families of American hostages

description: In a 4-2 decision, the Arizona Supreme Court struck down the state’s current 15-week ban on abortion and reinstated a law from 1864, nearly 50 years before Arizona became a state. The law bans nearly all abortions in Arizona with no exceptions for rape or incest.
title: Arizona Supreme Court reinstates 160-year-old abortion ban

description: The Biden administration has announced the first-ever national standard for drinking water. The White House says it will protect 100 million Americans from harmful chemicals coming out of their taps.
title: Biden administration announces national standard for drinking water

description: Gold medalists across the 48 events on the track and field program at this year's Paris Olympics will get $50,000, World Athletics announced.
title: Track and field gold medalists will get $50,000 at Olympics

description: Americans estimate they’ll need $1.46 million saved to retire comfortably, according to a new study. That’s a 53% increase from what people thought they needed just four years ago. Business analyst Jill Schlesinger talks about how you can save more for retirement.
title: How to save enough for retirement

description: President Biden sharpens his criticism of Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the war in Gaza, saying he doesn't "agree with his approach."
title: Biden calls Netanyahu's handling of the war in Gaza "a mistake"

description: A violent storm is barreling through the Southeast, flooding roads, knocking out power and causing at least two suspected tornadoes.
title: Severe weather, flooding, possible tornadoes threaten Southeast

description: Inflation is rising again. Here's what that means for mortgage rates and homebuyers.
title: What the new inflation report mean for mortgages

description: Former Trump Organization CFO Allen Weisselberg was sentenced Wednesday to five months in New York City's Rikers Island jail complex.
title: Former Trump Organization CFO Allen Weisselberg sentenced for perjury

description: The average day camp costs $87 per day, the American Camp Association says. Like many industries, summer camps have been impacted by inflation, but there are ways you can keep the costs down.
title: Tips on how to cut costs for summer camp as prices increase

description: The toxic train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, forced nearly 2,000 people from their homes. But some aren't satisfied with Norfolk Southern’s $600 million settlement. Residents say it doesn’t go far enough to address the health struggles they’ve experienced. Norfolk Southern said in a statement that the agreement does not include any admission of wrongdoing.
title: Residents unhappy with $600 million class-action settlement in East Palestine train derailment

description: A whistleblower who came forward after a Boeing 737 Max Jet lost a door panel in the air is raising new questions over the company’s safety measures. Sources tell CBS News that federal regulators are now looking into his claims over a different Boeing jet, which the company denies.
title: Boeing whistleblower raises new concerns over company’s safety measures

description: James and Jennifer Crumbley, the parents of the Oxford High School shooter, will serve at least 10 years in prison, a judge said Tuesday. The two were found guilty of involuntary manslaughter in separate trials earlier this year.
title: James and Jennifer Crumbley, parents of the Oxford High School shooter, are sentenced

description: The hotter-than-expected inflation reading could cause the Federal Reserve to delay interest rate cuts, analysts said.
title: Inflation runs hot for a third straight month, led by by gas and rent

description: In 2020, Anderson Cooper reported on companies seeking out potential employees with autism, and the employment opportunities being made available to people on the autism spectrum.
title: Recruiting for talent on the autism spectrum | 60 Minutes Archive

description: Arizona faces a near-total abortion ban, after the state Supreme Court revives a 19th century law. Also, millions of Americans are under the threat of severe weather Wednesday. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Arizona's near-total abortion ban is a revival of a 19th century law

description: Police told a German newspaper that the 51-year-old employee hoped sneaking in his painting would be his breakthrough.
title: Art gallery employee fired after sneaking in his own art

description: James Brenner, the man charged in Dylan Rounds' death, reportedly led authorities to the burial site.
title: Accused killer reportedly leads officials to missing teen's remains

description: The GOP-controlled Senate in Tennessee advanced a bill allowing some teachers to carry handguns on public school grounds. The measure follows last year's Covenant School shooting.
title: Bill to arm teachers advances in Tennessee in wake of deadly school shooting

description: Luke Fleurs, 24, was gunned down last week as he refilled his car at a gas station. Detectives later recovered his car.
title: 6 arrested in soccer star's murder at South African gas station

description: The EPA will require that public water utilities test for six different types of PFAS chemicals to reduce exposure in drinking water.
title: EPA issues first-ever regulations for "forever chemicals" in drinking water

description: Explore how Matbakhi intend to revolutionize the Saudi Arabian hospitality market. With a focus on an innovative business model, digitization and empowerment of local chefs, Matbakhi enhances guest experiences and hotel profitability, heralding a new era in the F&B and hotel industry.
title: How Matbakhi is Disrupting the Hospitality Food and Beverage in KSA

description: Environmental services provider, PreZero, continually seeks new methods to maximize waste recycling efficiency. This dedication to innovation in the recycling process results in impressive projects and fosters a network of global partnerships.
title: PreZero: Diverse Paths in the Circular Economy

description: From providing indispensable tech to sports like the NFL and EPL, to pioneering data-driven fan engagement, immersive content and advertising tools for brands, broadcasters and sportsbooks, Genius Sports is redefining sports experiences everywhere.
title: The Smart Tech Behind the Next Generation of Immersive Fan Experiences

description: The FCC is requiring internet providers to tell consumers exactly what they're getting in their broadband plans.
title: Internet providers roll out broadband "nutrition" labels for consumers

description: The U.S. tax system is designed to be progressive, with rich people paying a larger share of their income to the IRS. Here's what to know.
title: Americans think they pay too much in taxes. Here's who pays the most.

description: President Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Kishida are expected to announce an enhanced defense and intelligence partnership this week, in the face of hostility from China.
title: Biden, Kishida to announce ramped-up U.S.-Japan military partnership

description: Court documents in the case of three San Jose family members charged in the alleged child-abuse death of a three-year-old girl during a brutal 2021 exorcism ritual at a makeshift church reveal the child fought to escape even as she declared her love for her mother, who was one of her assailants.
title: Young girl who died during 2021 San Jose "exorcism" fought for her life, court documents say

description: Arizona Supreme Court rules abortion ban from 1864 can be enforced; Nonprofit provides free guide dogs for the visually impaired
title: 4/9: CBS Evening News

description: Stanford University announced Tara VanDerveer, its Director of Women's Basketball and coach, will retire after a historic career.
title: Stanford's Tara VanDerveer, NCAA's all-time winningest basketball coach, to retire

description: Arizona Supreme Court rules 1864 abortion ban can be enforced; father of Israeli-American hostage held by Hamas discusses meeting at White House with Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: 4/9: America Decides

description: John Dickerson reports on Arizona enforcing an 1864 abortion law, an ISIS threat made against soccer stadiums in Europe, and new EPA rules on chemical plants.
title: 4/9: Prime Time with John Dickerson

description: In his letter, Khanna argued that polling suggests that in swing states, Kennedy could tilt the November election in former President Donald Trump's favor.
title: Rep. Ro Khanna calls on RFK Jr.'s running mate to step down

description: The Environmental Protection Agency is rolling out new regulations to limit chemical plants from releasing toxic substances into the air. Michael Gerrard, professor at Columbia University's Climate School, joins CBS News to assess the policy.
title: New EPA toxic air rule expected to face legal challenges

description: Anonymous online supporters of ISIS have issued a threat to three major soccer stadiums in Europe. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab reports on how authorities are responding.
title: ISIS threatens major soccer stadiums across Europe

description: A judge on Tuesday sentenced the parents of the Oxford, Michigan, high school shooter to 10-15 years in prison each. CBS News Detroit reporter Andres Gutierrez was inside the courtroom as James and Jennifer Crumbley heard from the families of their son's four victims.
title: Inside James and Jennifer Crumbley's sentencing

description: The buying price of gold futures has hit multiple record highs this year, rising more than 14% in value since Jan. 2. Campbell Harvey, professor of finance at Duke University, joins CBS News to explain what's motivating buyers.
title: Why are gold prices suddenly hitting record highs?

description: Maryland officials went to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to lobby for more funding to rebuild Baltimore's Key Bridge. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion explains what's standing in the way.
title: House Freedom Caucus pushes back on Baltimore bridge funding

description: Arizona's Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld an abortion law from 1864 that would criminalize the procedure with barely any exceptions. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes reports on the present consequences. Then, New York Times national reporter Kate Zernike joins to discuss.
title: What to know about Arizona's Civil War-era abortion ban

description: Missouri executed death row inmate Brian Dorsey on Tuesday night after the Supreme Court declined to intervene. A jury convicted Dorsey of killing his cousin and her husband in 2006. Public defenders argued Dorsey should not be put to death because of good behavior and claimed his trial lawyers had a conflict of interest.
title: Missouri executes death row inmate Brian Dorsey

description: It was a "bittersweet moment" as United Launch Alliance brought the Delta program to a close.
title: Final Delta 4 Heavy puts NRO spy satellite into space
